str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
Feminine of a presumed derivative apparently from the base of chasma through the idea of deficiency; a widow, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Descended, subst: a descendant. Neuter of a derivative of a compound of ek and ginomai; a descendant, i.e. grandchild.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation from a primary verb, another form of which, matheo, is used as an alternate in certain tenses; to learn.
To be dutiful, pious, show piety towards, worship. From eusebes; to be pious, i.e. to worship, or to respect.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Pertaining to self, i.e. One's own; by implication, private or separate.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
And, even, also, namely.
From apo and didomi; to give away, i.e. Up, over, back, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An ancestor. From proginomai; an ancestor, parent.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Worthy to be received (welcomed), acceptable, welcome, pleasant. From apodechomai; accepted, i.e. Agreeable.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
